availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Fleming County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Sarah Johnson Barber. Father of Gennetta Barber, Louisiana A. Barber, Landers Barber, Lewis Barber, George William Barber, John J. Barber, and Louvena Mary A. Barber. Captain of the 24th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) from December 1861 to January 1865. Captain of Captain Barberâ€™s Company (Fleming County State Guard) (U.S.A.) from June 1865 to November 1865.

ab.bibl: Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2 (Frankfort: John H. Harney, Public Printer, 1866), 174, 900. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, Division 2. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, p. 51. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, Hillsboro Precinct, p. 14.
